newsitem.title: FINLAND: FORECAST - Kone '96 profit seen well down. [CORRECTED 12:20 GMT]
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Kone '96 profit seen well down. [CORRECTED 12:20 GMT]

text.p: A Reuters survey of analysts covering Finnish equities showed an 85 million markka median forecast for lift maker Kone Oy's full-year 1996 profit before extraordinary items and tax:
(EPS forecasts by 12 analysts, profit forecasts by 14). @
Kone's results are due on February 7 in the morning.
In 1995, Kone posted a 202 million markka profit before extraordinary items and tax.
For Kone's full-year 1997 profit, nine of the 13 analysts polled gave a median forecast of 165 million markka (mean 141 million) in a 28-237 million markka range.

Contributors to the survey were Aros Securities, AG Private Bankers, Alfred Berg, Carnegie, Enskilda, Erik Selin, Evli Securities, Kleinwort Benson, FIM Securities, Handelsbanken, Interbank, Merita Securities, Opstock and Postipankki.
